alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Worcester County through 300 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Snow Hill, or 15 miles east of Pocomoke City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newark around 230 PM EDT. Berlin around 255 PM EDT. Cape Isle Of Wight and Ocean Pines around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ironshire, West Ocean City, Ocean City Municipality and Public Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland.
